statistics.tests

Class TTests

  • java.lang.Object
    • statistics.tests.TTests

  • public class TTests
extends java.lang.Object
    This class performs the t-test by checking if the score exceeds the critical values. The output of these methods is to be interpreted as follows below: 0: no significance, 1: .05 level 2: .01 level

    • Method Detail

      • pairedTwoTailed

        public int pairedTwoTailed(float[] resA,
                  float[] resB)
        Paired two-tailed t-test.
        Parameters:
        resA - First float value array.
        resB - Second float value array.
        Returns:
        0: no significance, 1: .05 level 2: .01 level

      • pairedTwoTailedCorrectedResampled

        public int pairedTwoTailedCorrectedResampled(float[] resA,
                                    float[] resB,
                                    float fracTrain,
                                    float fracTest)
        Paired two-tailed t-test, corrected re-sampled, for use in cross-validation hypothesis testing . Note that fracTrain + fracTest = 1.
        Parameters:
        resA - First float value array.
        resB - Second float value array.
        fracTrain - fraction of the data used for training
        fracTest - fraction of the data used for testing
        Returns:
        0: no significance, 1: .05 level 2: .01 level

      • pairedTwoTailed

        public int pairedTwoTailed(double[] resA,
                  double[] resB)
        Paired two-tailed t-test.
        Parameters:
        resA - First double value array.
        resB - Second double value array.
        Returns:
        0: no significance, 1: .05 level 2: .01 level

      • pairedTwoTailedCorrectedResampled

        public int pairedTwoTailedCorrectedResampled(double[] resA,
                                    double[] resB,
                                    float fracTrain,
                                    float fracTest)
        Paired two-tailed t-test, corrected re-sampled, for use in cross-validation hypothesis testing . Note that fracTrain + fracTest = 1.
        Parameters:
        resA - First double value array.
        resB - Second double value array.
        fracTrain - fraction of the data used for training
        fracTest - fraction of the data used for testing
        Returns:
        0: no significance, 1: .05 level 2: .01 level

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        arg0: One csv file with two columns to be compared by the corrected re-sampled t-test. First line in the file is the number of rows.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments. A single argument pointing to the csv file that contains the columns to be compared, preceded by a number of rows on a separate line.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
